learning_outcomes.description: Understand conceptual models involving spatial data analysis
Design geoprocessing models to solve application problems
Apply statistical techniques to explore spatial data patterns and relationships
Perform spatial analysis and modelling to data along networks
Choose and apply appropriate spatial analysis methods to solve geographical problems
Understand and appreciate the emerging sources of big data and geocomputation techniques
Interpret and effectively communicate spatial data and analytical output to non-expert audiences

assessments.task_description: This assignment 1 is based on lectures and practicals you learnt in the first FOUR weeks. The questions will be provided at the end of Practicals 1-3. You need to submit this assignment through Turnitin by the due date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted. You should also retain an identical electronic copy of the work submitted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: This assignment 2 is based mainly on the lectures and practicals you learnt in Weeks 5-8. The questions will be provided at the end of Practicals 4-6. You need to submit this assignment through Turnitin by the due date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted. You should also retain an identical electronic copy of the work submitted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: For this assignment you will develop an online StoryMap following best practice for GIS communication. Details on this assignment requirement will be provided via BB during the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted. You should also retain an identical electronic copy of the work submitted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This End of Semester exam consists of multiple choice questions, as well as short answer and problem-solving questions related to spatial data models and analysis. The questions are based on lecture and reading contents and its applications throughout the semester.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
